staff Chicago White Sox pitcher Mark Buehrle is raising eyebrows over his recent comments about Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Michael Vick , who has bounced back after being jailed for his role in a dogfighting ring in 2007. Under BSF, every secondary school in England was due to be rebuilt or refurbished over a 15-20-year period at an estimated cost of Â£ 55 billion. Michael Gove said the programme had been beset by massive overspends, tragic delays, botched construction projects and needless bureaucracy. The decision is a further embarrassment for the Education Secretary who was forced to apologise last summer after he released a flawed list of school building projects facing the axe. its current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice president of engineering and research. Even if it surpasses 31,000 employees this year, Google Inc. will still have far fewer people than Microsoft Corp., probably its fiercest rival.
